isis.stitle: TSI 99-03-01 - Rubber Spring Eye Bushing Bolt Tightening Specification for 91/92/9400 4x2 and 6x4 Models with 12K or 14K lb. Capacity Front Suspension and a Build Date Starting March 1, 1999

subjectgroup.subject: Rubber Spring Eye Bushing Bolt Tightening Specification for 91/92/9400 4x2 and 6x4 Models with 12K or 14K lb. Capacity Front Suspension and a Build Date Starting March 1, 1999

geninfo.para: Effective March 1, 1999 all 9100, 9200 and 9400 4x2 and 6x4 Models with 12,000 and 14,000 lb. capacity front suspensions have rubber spring eye bushings as standard replacing the threaded steel pin bushings.

Although threaded steel pin bushings are available as an option (Navistar Code 03WAH), rubber spring eye bushings provide longer life, quieter operation, improved road shock isolation and never need lubrication.

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: Whenever performing service to the springs, it is important that the front spring eye bushing bolts and the spring shackle bolts be tightened to 330 to 370 ft-lbs. (447 to 502 Nm) of torque to assure system integrity ( Figure 1).
